name: Cove Inn on Naples Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited here 14 years ago. We enjoyed our stay here so much that as we were touring Florida again we thought we would re-visit. From the outside it looks like a '60s motel - not particularly enticing. Once you enter your room and look out of the window at the wonderful view of the marina you realise what a bargain you have got.
reviews.title: Superb View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Slightly disappointed that on check in we asked if both restaurants were open to which the chap on reception confirmed - to find later that the one we had enjoyed previously was closed for refurbishment - which had been one of the reasons we wanted to come back.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with beautiful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: However, our room 224? was tastefully furnished and extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice deluxe experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We would go back (as long as 'The Dock' was open).
reviews.title: A gift!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to the Cove the last 3 holidays we have had in Naples and we just love
reviews.title: Lovely stay in tranquil setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was wonderful with view of pool and boats in harbor. Parking plentiful. Two good restaurants closeby (The Dock and Boathouse). Very reasonable rates. Units are owned individually so are different from each other. Only problem in our unit was difficult to operate vertical blinds on sliders to deck. Otherwise, unit was fine.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights. Room overlooking marina with patio. Lovely views across bay and great location for dining. Had a great meal at the Dock Restaurant just a few steps away from our room. Although hotel and restaurants busy there was no noise once patio door closed. All amenities provided. Room very clean. Breakfast at the Coffee Shoppe downstairs is outstanding. Staff very helpful in despatching my left behind laptop! Hotel on tourist bus route - 2 hour journey which was very interesting but you could hop on/off at any stop. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Fabulous spot and great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Super clean. Quiet and convenient. We've seen just one youngster, no spring breakers. Great breakfast place, restaurants and chickee bar on site. Shopping and beach within walking distance. Yes bathrooms are small but positves FAR out way that. We'd rather have the space outside the bathroom. Mini fridge, coffee maker and microwave big help in saving money as Naples is expensive!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is a no frills kind of place. The rooms are straight out of 1960, but clean and a good price. GREAT location, right on Naples Bay marina.
reviews.title: Good price, great location, friendly place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and we were blessed with perfect weather. The hotel has a fabulous location and the pool area could not be better, it is an all day sun trap.The hotel is really acondominium resort and as such all rooms are different, our room was agood size but over filled with furniture by the owners other rooms i saw were the same size but with more suitable furnishings, if possible get to look at what is available before you book. The staff at reception are very helpful and the hotel is kept very clean. What makes this place special is the location and for the price it would be hard to beat in Naples.If you want loads of activities this is not for you it is aimed at the older crowd or people who just want to relax, there are two restaurnts on site and lots within walking distance.Great place for a rest. We will return.
reviews.title: wow what a location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: After last years wonderful holiday at the cove, we took our sister and family there and all had, our best ever holiday. We have already booked for 2 weeks next November as we love this time of year over there and it will save you a fair amount of cash being out of there high season.
reviews.title: Booked 2012 already

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other reviewers are right, we should not be shouting how great this place is and keep this special place to ourselves but that would be unfair.
reviews.title: Yes, we went back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are looking for a first class holiday in the Naples bay area at a reasonable rate, then look no further. You will not be dissapointed
reviews.title: the Cove never fails

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Three visits in 5 months...it just gets better...not a fancy place, just friendly, well-priced (we go off-season to save $$) We have been in two differnt rooms/areas of the hotel...each special and individual in its own right....just want to relax and enjoy? This is the place....and yet there is so much to do within a short walk/bike ride!!! Wait a minute...why am I telling everyone about this special hideaway!!??!!
reviews.title: Truly Truly we enjoyed our stay at this beautiful resort in Naples!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have just returned from our annual holiday in Naples at the Cove. We are missing it already & cant wait to returne the place is amazing the staff wonderfull & you cant beat the fabulouse breakfast in the coffee shop. A special thanks to Fredrick on the desk Dora who is the best chambermain & all the Girls in the coffee shop see ya soon xxx
reviews.title: Please dont come here!
3rd visit in 3 years
reviews.text: Do not tell ANYONE about this place...... It's a secret! The location is fantastic, rooms are lovely, and staff are all very friendly. To top that, you have two restaurants either side, a water shuttle to take you on a 9 stop (possibly .... pub related) tour for $5.00 pp per day, a lovely breakfast bar, that you have to queue (briefly) for....it just couldn't be better....its been our third year on the trot....so remember, don't tell a soul.....ssshhhhhhhh ;-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in room 138 for 2 nights, 26th - 27th Oct.. The visitor centre offered this as one of three options."It's not on the beach, but on a marina". Bingo. A collection of condo's, huge room, super comfortable king size bed and spectacular setting, clean and quiet. Between the four of us (our friends from Canada also had a room) we had a car, but we chose to walk downtown and to the pier. A gem and excellent value in a wonderful town.
reviews.title: Could not believe our luck
Well worth a visit
reviews.text: Stayed here recently, views across the bay from hotel room are great. Rooms vary in fixtures and fittings due to them being privately owned but all of reasonable standard, no safes in room but valuables can be put behind front desk, found staff cheerful and friendly. Would reccommend visiting 3rd ave for cheaper restaurants than 5th ave in naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is a great place to relax and enjoy.We spent three days.Our room had a wonderful view of the marina.It was clean and tastefully decorated.There is a trolley to enjoy the city tour.One of the convinience of the Cove Inn is its laundromat.We spent a nice stay.I recommend the Cove Inn highly enough.
reviews.title: Cove Inn... a place to relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three days at the Cove Inn and were very impressed. From the moment we checked in, the service from the staff throughout the complex could not be faulted. We were a little apprehensive about our room (or should I say "efficiency") as we'd heard varying comments about the condition of some of the rooms. However, we were very lucky and had a wonderful room, which was clean, modern and tastefully decorated (room 209). We also had a wonderful view over the marina.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in a great value complex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had one of the penthouse apartments that overlooked the marina. it was fabulous. location was great and several restaurants were walking distance. the only down side was the road and car park were on the other side of the apartments and we were woken early every day by someone pulling in with loud indicators or radio blaring or just talking. We managed as our daughter is nearly eight but if you had younger children I could imagine it would be a problem. It is difficult because it is such a wonderful place. The pool is on the small side but was fine. Strongly recommend a trip on Sweet Liberty the catamaran that takes you out to spot dolphins. we saw a couple which was not as many as we had hoped but the trip was fabulous. take lots of sun screen.
reviews.title: fabulous location but can be noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just returned home,8/15/11, my 13 year. Stayed in room, 124, decor, pale , bright shades, oh yeah, and the view! See guests I have known for years, made new ones also. The front desk, hats off to, Frederick, Judy, Jeff, and Phillip. Tranquility, noise free, watch the boats go cruising by. travel by myself, single female, secure, very private, crime free. The Cove Inn, see you real soon. Rose. Thank you.
reviews.title: The View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Everyone and everything was amazing. The cafe in the hotel had the best pancakes ever!!! The location was great. Definitely coming back!!
reviews.title: Perfect, inexpensive romantic getaway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This place was described to me as the best kept secret in Naples and it just might be true. I have stayed here several times this summer and absolutely love the place. It sits right next to Naples City Dock in the Crayton Cove area of Naples. It has a great Tiki Bar right on the water and a diner in the lobby that has some of the best breakfast food I've ever had. Naples locals frequent the restaurant - it's that good. The rooms are super clean and well maintained. The service is amazing - we have needed some special help a couple of times resulting from coming in by boat - and the staff is always super accommodating. This place is not "Ritzy" Naples, although the 5th Avenue Shops are very nearby if you are interested. The Cove in has a great Florida feel, great rooms and great service. Everything you want from a hotel.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent hotel - nice large room - great location in front of marina in a quiet area
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: These condos are down by the harbour with excellent views over Naples bay . The rooms are all individually owned , so all are done to a different standard. Ours was on the first floor plain white decor, clean but getting dated. It had a full kitchen with microwave but very few utensils, cutlery or crockery. The floor was ceramic tiled with vertical blinds hung over the full patio window, these kept falling off whilst accessing the balcony. We had a large king bed which was comfortable and there was plenty of cupboard space , table and chairs. The balcony also had a seperate mosquito netting door this and the balcony doors kept coming off the runners but were easily refitted.
reviews.title: Oh I do like to be beside the seaside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a laundry room at the end of the first floor , which is reasonably priced and a fully stocked library about half way along .
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chickies bar sits on the quayside and is run by some very pleasant ladies from early afternoon until 10:00P.M everyone made us feel welcome.
reviews.title: We loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To either side of the property are restaurants but if you want to go further afield the water taxi takes you downtown and runs from midday until 9:30 P.M it only costs $5 for the day and even pulls up to the bar if you wave it over.( well worth the 45 minute round trip.)
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For breakfast , the shop cafe is just off reception, run by some fiesty older ladies who have a great sense of humour and also serve up a good breakfast.
reviews.title: Great room and fantastic view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the cove for a week with our friends following a week's cruise in the carribean. We had read the reviews prior to the vacation so were expecting it to be good. We were not disappointed. We had booked a penthouse room as it had the 2 separate bedrooms and had the space we had wanted. On arrival, we were met in reception by a very courteous and friendly member of staff who promptly attended to the paperwork followed by directions to our room. On opening the door's to the balcony of our 3rd floor room we realised what an amazing location we were in. The views were spectacular overlooking the marina.
reviews.title: WOW...impressed in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everywhere was spotlessly clean and Josefina, our room maid came in everyday to keep it that way.
reviews.title: fabulous view, awesome place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location of this Inn could not have been better. I suppose the best recommendation I can give is that we have already booked the same room for 2 WEEKS next year.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Cove inn for 2 nights and couldn't have picked a better spot. The location is great, close to 5th Ave, beach and pier, and it's right on the bay. The view of the marina is so awesome, there is a sitting area waterfront that I enjoyed in the evening. The pool area is nice with a tiki bar within reach. There are 2 great restaurants and a pizza place steps away. There's also a cafe in the lobby that has a great breakfast. The room itself was spacious enough for me and my hubby, the vanity area especially. There is a kitchenette area stocked w utensils, plates, etc. The beds were comfty. nice flat screen, clean bathroom. The staff were helpful and personable. They also let you use beach chairs, umbrellas and towels for the beach (at no charge), which we did. I got a great price which makes it even better. I would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Paradise found!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Older hotel with lots of history... Stayed here a few times over the past few years and enjoy the view and tiki bar. Was happy to find out that they now have wifi in all rooms...
reviews.title: Great Value for Retreat/relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay here, if we had more time, we would have tried to stay another night. Our room was big and well decorated. We had a fridge, microwave and coffee pot. The only bad thing was the bathroom, it was very small, but sufficient.....But the view, AWESOME. We sat on our balcony porch and watched all of the excitement of the boaters/boats and the fun at the Chickee Bar. We loved all of this so much, when dinner time rolled around, we ordered Pizza so we wouldn't have to leave the view and the fun.
reviews.title: Loved the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night after visiting the Keys for several days. The room we had was very light and airy with a kitchen and a good sized bathroom. Our balcony overlooked the Marina and we were able to check out a lot of boats and the people that owned them. Since we're from Kansas that was a treat. We ate at the open air restaurant connected to the marina. It seemed to be very popular and the food was great. Also check out the Cove Inn Coffee Shop. A delicious breakfast and super fast service. It's like a down home cafe--very friendly with lots of regular customers--the waitress knew most of them. We would go back if given the chance!
reviews.title: lovely room, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watching Dolphins in the marina from the balcony was a highlight.
reviews.title: Great location, Good value and dolphins were a bonus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was clean, comfortable, well furnished and equiped with everything you could need.
reviews.title: Great location, great value, great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: We liked the fact iit was in a quiet location and you could walk to the beach or the main street easily so you did not need the car all the time which is often the case in the USA.
reviews.title: Great staff and fantasic value for money in a rich area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a few nights at the Cove Inn, just for a long weekend get away. The hotel was very clean, inside and out. We really enjoyed the balcony overlooking the marina, and City Docks. Staff was all very nice, from the front desk personel, to the room service staff, to the bartender at the Chickee Bar. Onsite restaurants were all very good, with great water views.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish it was a little closer to the shops and restaurants on 5th Ave, and Tin City. We were hoping to be able to walk, but found it to be farther than we wanted to walk, but it was an easy, and very short drive.
reviews.title: Great Value - Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WIFI is available, but no signal in our room. If they are going to have it, they should upgrade it to be more usable. We had an air card, so it didn't inconvenience us at all. They do have a PC available for use in the lobby if wanting to check email, search menus etc.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Love, the Cove Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy with the value of the hotel. Clean is important, and the Cove Inn is. If wanting to visit Naples again, we would definately consider the Cove Inn again. We have already recommended it to a family member that visits Naples occasionally.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Cove Inn for a long weekend/romantic getaway and the hotel delivered in every way. We had a second floor room over the lobby area and though it was small, it was perfect for the two of us (even with a bunch of luggage). The room had a bit of an odd setup with no sink in the bathroom and only one in the kitchen (right outside the bathroom door). A bit strange, but the room was clean and fun with a cottagey feel and perfect view of the bay from the balcony.
reviews.title: 7.5 out of 10 - Good Value but Not Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was cleam, comfortable and well decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The view of the marina, bay & pool area was GREAT. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The location with the proximity to restaurants, shopping and sightseeing was also outstanding. Will definately return for a longer stay. Three nights were just not enough.
reviews.title: It was absolutely Fabulous!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Cove for 4 nights and found that the location and view from the balcony was great. We had the Penthouse suite which was a good size for 4 people with a lovely view over the pool and the bay where the boats were moored. It was very clean, the only criticism being the air conditioning on one of the balconies was very noisy and had to be turned off at night. The two restaurants at each end of the Cove Inn were good and quite reasonable especially if eating before 6.45pm. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great location and view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found Cove Inn in the Room Saver magazine and were thilled with the apartment. Beautiful room and views with a good sized bathroom. We could only stay for 3 nights before our long flight home to Sydney. We had been to San Juan, on a Caribbean cruise and then picked up a hire car in Miami. After touring Florida we can confidently say that this is the best place we stayed in. We relaxed watching the dolphins play in the Marina, the Paddle Boarders and the activity on the Marina and in the bar below. It was a casual walk to the Pier and Beach and to Tin City. The only problem we had in our time in Naples was at the Boathouse Restaurant next to Cove Inn. The waiter insisted on us giving him his tip, while we were eating, because he was finishing his shift. Not good! And there was one rogue oyster, glad my husband ate it!!
reviews.title: Excellant Location, Great Aspect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were looking for an efficiency at a good price in Naples and found it here. The room was spotless and well-equipped with lovely views over the marina. It got a bit noisy one night when the motel was full for the annual water races, but other than that was good. The restaurants are good, but quite expensive so we only ate in the once. All the rooms are different as this is a condominium hotel and all are privately owned. Maybe this is why internet is only available in the reception area. Reception was airy and pleasant and the staff were excellent and friendly. I was not impressed with the Coffee Shoppe for breakfast, thought it overpriced and the staff not too friendly. It was a nice place for a family holiday with our little girl (aged 2) because of its proximity to the old town. Overall it was a most enjoyable experience and we plan to return for another break later in the year
reviews.title: Lovely location in old Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Cove Inn is situated on the marina and it was lovely to sit on the balcony in the evening and relax. Our room was possibly a little dated and the bathroom was tiny but the location made up for it. Breakfast is taken in a crowded coffee shop and we had to wait for a table but breakfast was good. The wifi is not available in the rooms but you can take your laptop to the lobby. The staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: what a totally awesome, relaxing, fun, friendly, incredible hidden treasure this place truly is...the second we walked in the door and discovered the treasure we had found, the stress just disappeared and we were ready to relax and enjoy....the bay shuttle..the restaurants within walking distance...the pier....this 1st visit was only a one night and all we can talk about is going back....great staff, friendly, helpful and beyond....our room had a guest book dating back to 1989 with comments from all over the world...plus a stash of books, shells, and helpful hints...just thinking about this place has me e-mailing my boss about my scheduling next..longer...vacation....
reviews.title: Shhhhh...it's a secret..don't tell anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent seven great days at this fantastic hidey hole. The room overlooked the marina with great views from the balcony. The room was very clean and well looked after by our maid Dora. The rest of the staff were very helpful and friendly, they couldn't do enough to make our stay the best we have ever had in Florida. The coffee shop downstairs served the most awesome pecan pancakes. Both restaurants nearby served great food too. Cannot recommend this place more highly. Definitely a place to go. We will return.
reviews.title: Fantastic, Fantatic, Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a great value - so clean, staff was so friendly, & everything you could need in walking distance. On site property restaurant was great, the Chickee bar had super friendly service and drinks were not overpriced. Pool and entire property were spotless. Took (less than?) a mile walk to the pier on the beach and saw dolphin right in front of us. Downtown 5th ave is super close too. I will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Excellent Long Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for the weekend of May 14th. Was pleasantly surprised by just how perfect it was. Our room on the second floor looked out over the marina. The room was small but served our needs perfectly...There's even a little fridge, microwave, dishes, etc. if you need them. My only complaint was that every single time we opened the door to our room, there was a "funny" smell. Never could put our finger on what it was but all i could think of was cat pee....Other than that, everything was perfect. Had dinner at the Dock our first night which was great (those two for one happy hour margaritas KILLED me!) Dinner at the boat house the following night. Had cocktails at the tiki bar, too and had a really good time. Breakfast in the little coffee shop in the lobby was so so. Had to wait quite a while and it was just average.
reviews.title: Great place. Perfect in just about every way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: All in all, I'd definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Wow, what a treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was going to Naples for business for a day, but decided to make a one night get away of the trip with my boyfriend. The other reviews on Trip Advisor convinced me to try out the Cove Inn and I am so glad we did. We had a water view hotel room and absolutely loved it. Our room was charmingly decorated, but we both thought the best feature was the balcony. Its so peaceful to sit out and watch the boats on the water. The location of the hotel is perfect too. We walked to both 3rd Street and 5th Avenue to do some exploring. There is a cute Tiki bar on the property and its right next door to the Dock restaurant. We went a block further for dinner though to Bleu Provence. An adorable and absolutely delicious French restaurant. I would definitely stay at the Cove Inn again. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful Water Views and a Relaxing Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was travelling alone and needed to find a nice place to stay in Naples for a night. I had an accomodation voucher and decided to try The Cove Inn ( I never thought I would get in as it has the best location in Naples!) but I was sucessful. The check in staff were very friendly and I was alloted a very lovely room with a view over the marina and the beautiful yachts and boats. I spent the afternoon at the pool and the 'coolest' poolside Tiki Bar! I then used the Naples water Schuttle and for a very low fee I cruised around the bay and chatted to the locals who also use the water Schuttle as a sunset cruise. All in all a very lovely stay, the room was magnificent and the stay was memorable. Also had the best breakfast in Naples in the Cafe at the Cove Inn!
reviews.title: Wonderful view and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Me and my parents have been coming here every year since I was 2 and we absolutely love it! It feels like our second home, the people are more than friendly, the rooms are amazing, the food is to die for..everything is perfect. Strongly recommend!
reviews.title: An amazing stay every time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two days and had a great time. The small condo we had was loverly, with a kitchenette, dining table, couch, bed and balcony. Lots of food options and it was just wonderful to watch the boats bobbing on the water in front of our room. The only problem we encountered was when we checked out on sunday morning and the woman on the desk was brusque to the point of rudeness. She really needs to develop a customer service attitude with a dose of civility and even a smile might help. I appreciate she may have been busy but needs to remember that its the customers who enable her to have a job, so being civil and pleasant would go a long way to her retaining it
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was really surprised at the rooms. Very clean. The building is old but they have updated at much as possible and it is really nice clean place, exceptionally placed in the center of resturants, shopping and The Bay. Nice Tiki Bar and nice pool. VERY reasonably priced! I would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice Place, beautiful setting!

aka: Cove Inn On Naples Bay Hotel Naples
